greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime Hurwitz quaternions of norm n.
reference: L. E. Dickson, Algebras and Their Arithmetics, Dover, 1960, Section 91.
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = number of vectors of norm n in D_4 lattice (A004011) if n is a prime, otherwise a(n) = 0.
mathematica: a[p_?PrimeQ] := Reduce[ a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2 == 4p, {a, b, c, d}, Integers] // Length; a[_] = 0; Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 78}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 03 2012 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 09 2000
ext: More terms from Lambert Klasen (Lambert.Klasen(AT)gmx.net), Jun 10 2005
